It works fine!!

However...I was wondering, If I wanted to install custom content/mods/hacks etc...how would I go about doing this?

This site allows you to download their mods directly through the mod manager, and install them into Skyrim in a managed way. Not much thought is necessary, and the manager handles all file transactions.

If you want to install mods manually, most mods go in "[Install drive]: [Skyrim install folder] /Data/" .
However most mods will simply tell you how they should be installed.

If you were just wondering if mods are okay to use on a cracked copy, the answer is yes, and rest assured no extra steps are necessary compared to a purchased copy of the game.

And really, it was de rien.

Another quick question....(sorry) has this been updated to the newest patch...1.04? And would i be able to download future patches from Bethesda as well as any DLCs purchased?
BTW..I tried to install mods using Nexus mod manager...however mods do not show up in the game.  Is there a specific place where the game must be installed?

@labellavienna
You will not be able to get updates from Bethesda directly, as the only way to do this is through Steam. However, cracked updates are available through the pirate bay, and you can use those updates using what I have here. 

Yes, this is version 1.4 (read the file description)

Open Mod Manager, go to Settings -> Skyrim and make sure the install directory listed is the proper Skyrim game directory.

While still in Mod Manager, go to the Plugins tab and make sure you check all the check boxes and push "Launch Skyrim" from the mod manager. This will bring up the Skyrim Launch screen, whereupon you will see an option labelled "Data Files". Make sure all are checked here as well.

You will not need to always go through the Mod Manager first, but you should do so after installing a new mod.

If problems persist, please give a more detailed account thereof.

@skyrimplayer
I believe what you are describing is a bug, and I've heard of it before. You may want to try starting a new game.

As to the lack of audio, make sure nothing is muted,   never alt+tab out of the game, and check the ingame audio settings.

If all else fails, try simply reinstalling the game.
Always recheck the steps listed in the README.

if your problems persist, please give a more detailed account of your problem.

@JohnHolmesII I had the same problem as Samoht95 but i fixed it now, atm its saying im missing a second file named "binkw32.dll" would you know where/what the second update is?

@Jayzamine

That file is responsible for decoding Bink! Video files.

binkw32.dll is included in the .iso file I uploaded.

You either:

a) Deleted the file accidentally

b) Didn't extract the file correctly

c) Had a download error


Option 1: Download the file directly
http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?binkw32

And put it in the Skyrim game directory.

Option 2: Remove the torrent from your downloader and re-add it, set the download location to the same spot (don't override) and do a re-check (Usually a right click menu will have this option).
If the torrent finishes the re-check and is incomplete, just finish downloading.

If it finishes the re-check and is still at 100%, then simply re-install the game via the README.
*Make sure you click "Download ZIP-File" and not "Download binkw32 Fixer"

@TerrariaLover1
Go to My Documents -> My Games -> Skyrim
and open SkyrimPrefs.ini
Under the section titles [Launcher], find the line:
bEnableFileSelection

and make sure it is set to 1.
